title: Sinopec facing obstacles in Sri Lanka top Chinese scholar
byline: Sinopec, the leading Chinese petroleum company that has sought to invest in Sri Lanka, is facing obstacles in pressing ahead with implementation, a leading Chinese scholar who is presently in Sri Lanka told Daily Mirror yesterday.

title: Sumedha and Nadeeka to lead Sri Lanka at Asian Meet
byline: Sri Lanka Athletics (SLA) has named two international level athletes, Sumedha Ranasinghe and Nadeeka Lekamge as the Men’s and Women’s Captain for the 26th Asian Senior Athletic Championship 2025.

title: Tourist arrivals surge early May reaching 32% of 2025 target
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector showed improved growth in tourist arrivals in the first 13 days of May 2025, with an expansion of 21.53 percent year-on-year (YoY) compared to the same period in 2024.

title: SL finalises US$ 930.8mn restructuring package with India
byline: Sri Lanka has formalised a series of debt restructuring deals with the Export-Import Bank of India, covering credit lines and buyer’s credit facilities worth approximately US$ 930.8 million, the Finance Ministry said

title: LA 2028 Olympics plans air taxi service for spectators
byline: Spectators could fly through the Los Angeles skies and escape the city’s notorious traffic during the 2028 Olympic Games if the organisers have their way.

title: Two arrested at BIA with gold hidden among vehicle spare parts
byline: Two businessmen transporting gold worth Rs. 210 million, hidden among vehicle spare parts, were arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Abandoned coconut lands to be taken over by government: CCB Chairman
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board (CCB) announced that attention has been focused on taking over and developing 500,000 acres of coconut cultivation land that is currently uncultivated.

title: Deshabandu summoned before committee of inquiry
byline: Suspended IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon has been summoned before the committee of inquiry appointed to investigate and report on the alleged misconduct and serious abuse of office by the IGP on May 19.

title: Court rejects Bribery Commission’s request to re-remand of Chamara Sampath
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court a short while ago rejected the request made by the Bribery Commission to cancel the bail granted to Badulla District Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake and to have him remanded again in connection with financial irregularities he allegedly committed during his tenure as a member of the Uva Provincial Council in 2016.

title: Three accused sentenced to death for trafficking over 179 Kg of heroin
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Aditya Patabendi today sentenced three accused to death for the possession and trafficking of over 179 kilograms of heroin.

title: NPP ministers have sought our support to form administrations in certain local bodies: Mano
byline: There have been approaches made by certain JVP stalwart Minister friends seeking the support of the Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) members to form NPP administrations in certain LG councils, party leader Mano Ganesan said today.

title: Legal action taken against 11 long distance buses operating from Hatton
byline: Legal action have been taken against eleven bus drivers of long distance buses operating from Hatton for running the buses hazardously and with shortcomings.

title: High-end cars rerouted through Sri Lanka to evade Indian customs duties, Hyderabad dealer held
byline: Indian Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) investigators have arrested city-based luxury car dealership proprietor Basharat Ahmed Khan in connection with a 25 crore customs duty evasion case.

title: Issuing of vehicle number plates halted due to shortage
byline: Due to a shortage of vehicle number plates, the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has announced that the issuing of number plates has been suspended from April 28, DMT Commissioner General Kamal Amarasinghe said.

title: Tangalle High Court acquits SJB Beliatta co-organiser of firearm charges
byline: The Tangalle High Court today acquitted Ojith Liyanapathirana, the co-organiser for the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) in Beliatta, who had been indicted for the possession of a T56 automatic firearm and 24 rounds of live ammunition on or around October 10, 2010.

title: Hong Kong and Singapore report new Covid wave
byline: Covid cases are spiking across Southeast Asia, especially in Hong Kong and Singapore.

title: Bribery Commission seeks bail cancellation, re-remand of Chamara Sampath
byline: The Bribery Commission today requested the Colombo Chief Magistrate to cancel the bail granted to Badulla District Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake and to have him remanded again in connection with financial irregularities he allegedly committed during his tenure as a member of the Uva Provincial Council in 2016.

title: Sinopec facing obstacles in Sri Lanka: Top Chinese scholar
byline: Sinopec, the leading Chinese petroleum company that has sought to invest in Sri Lanka, is facing obstacles in pressing ahead with implementation, a leading Chinese scholar who is presently in Sri Lanka told Daily Mirror yesterday.

title: Hector Dias’ ’Meenachchi’ marks Sri Lankan Dolby Atmos debut on Apple Music
byline: Sri Lankan artist Hector Dias’s track ’’Meenachchi’’ is now offering an immersive Dolby Atmos experience on Apple Music, a development hailed by its collaborators as a ’’first for Sri Lanka’’ in providing such content on the platform.

title: Sri Lankan Buddhist Lawyers’ Association congratulates India’s new Chief Justice
byline: The Sri Lankan Buddhist Lawyers’ Association has extended its warmest congratulations to the newly appointed 51st Chief Justice of India, Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai, hailing his elevation as a historic and deeply inspiring moment for the Buddhist community.

title: Miss Universe Sri Lanka 2025 announces key partnership with Amanté
byline: Amanté, a leading intimate wear brand, will be the official main sponsor for Miss Universe Sri Lanka 2025. This collaboration highlights a mutual dedication to the empowerment of Sri Lankan women and aims to strengthen the country’s global presence in pageantry.

title: Government will not accept sending migrant workers to Israeli-held Palestinian lands: Bimal
byline: The government will not accept sending of migrant workers to places in Palestine which are held by Israel, Minister Bimal Ratnayake said.

title: Tennakoon to appear before inquiry committee on May 19
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon is scheduled to appear before the committee of inquiry investigating into allegations of misconduct and serious abuse of office against him on Monday at 2:00 p.m.

title: Station masters launch train strike
byline: All Station Masters have launched an islandwide strike, resulting in the cancellation of all night mail trains.

title: Shooting incident in Kotahena injures two
byline: A man and a woman were injured following a shooting incident in the Kotahena area a short while ago, police said.

title: Twelve suspects discharged over Easter Sunday bomb attacks
byline: Twelve suspects who were previously arrested and remanded on suspicion of aiding and abetting the perpetrators of the Easter Sunday bomb attacks were discharged today by Colombo Additional Magistrate Pasan Amarasinghe.

title: Arrest Warrant issued against Mahindananda
byline: An arrest warrant has been issued against former Agriculture Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage in connection with the ongoing investigation into the importation of Chinese fertilizer.

title: India-UK agreement major economic setback for Sri Lanka
byline: The recently signed free trade agreement between India and the United Kingdom on May 6 has raised fresh economic concerns for Sri Lanka, particularly at a time when the country is already grappling with hefty US-imposed tariffs, says Ratata Hetak Social Service Programme organiser Sarath Kalugamage.

title: Railway trade union action within the next 24 hours: Station Masters warn
byline: The Sri Lanka Railway Station Masters’ Union announced today that it will commence immediate trade union action within the next 24 hours, citing the government’s continued failure to address several longstanding issues.

title: Wildlife Department identifies 142 elephant crossing points near railway stations
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department has identified 142 railway stations across the country where wild elephants are known to roam, raising concerns over the ongoing human-elephant conflict.

title: Health Ministry responds to Daily Mirror article on Chickenpox vaccines
byline: The Ministry of Health has responded to a recent article published by the Daily Mirror regarding the availability of Chickenpox vaccines.

title: CSE uptrend continues on positive Quarter earnings
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the session on a positive note, continuing its upward momentum amid renewed investor confidence. The surge was driven by improved sentiment and strong quarterly earnings, with the banking sector leading the gains, while other sectors also showed positive performance.

title: Members of various local bodies to support NPP chairpersons: Bimal
byline: Claiming that members of various local bodies have agreed to support chairpersons of the National People’s Power (NPP), Minister Bimal Ratnayake said today that the NPP’s Vraie Cally Balthazaar is sure to become the Mayoress of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Indictments filed against Lakshman Yapa and former BOI DG
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has filed indictments against former Minister Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena and former Director General of the Board of Investment (BOI), Jayanta Edirisinghe, over the alleged misuse of BOI funds in 2014.

title: Ronaldo tops Forbes highest-paid athlete list again
byline: Cristiano Ronaldo has topped the Forbes list of highest-paid athletes for the third consecutive year, while NBA star Stephen Curry has moved up to second.

title: Over 100,000 Sri Lankans register for foreign employment this year
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that the number of Sri Lankans registering for foreign employment has surpassed 100,000 so far this year.

title: Nine university students, IUSF convener arrested over illegal protest
byline: At least nine university students including the convenor of the Inter University Students’ Federation (IUSF) were arrested by the police for engaging in an illegal protest in front of the Ministry of Health this afternoon.

title: 16th National War Heroes Commemoration ceremony to be held on May 19
byline: The Ministry of Defence said that the 16th National War Heroes Commemoration Ceremony will be held on May 19, 2025, at the National War Hero Cenotaph in Sri Jayawardenepura, Kotte, from 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.

title: Sri Lanka faces surge in dengue, chikungunya and influenza cases
byline: Sri Lanka is currently experiencing a significant increase in mosquito borne diseases, notably dengue and chikungunya, alongside a rise in influenza cases among children.
